definition: scorched and drenched by sun and rain (idiom); suffer from exposure to the elements/weather-beaten
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

(of the sun) to shine on/to bask in (the sunshine)/to dry (clothes, grain etc) in the sun/(fig.) to expose and share (one's experiences and thoughts) on the Web (loanword from "share")/(coll.) to give the cold shoulder to
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Huian female wearing the hats painted yellow paint, with the role of anti-sun and rain.
sentences.chinese: 惠安女头戴的斗笠涂上黄漆，具有防日晒雨淋作用。

sentences.english: Placed in dry and shady , avoid sun-baked and wringing.
sentences.chinese: 请放在阴凉干燥地方，避免日晒雨淋。

sentences.english: You may find both sun and rain, but you'll never feel alone.
sentences.chinese: 你就会发现不管日晒雨淋，你永远不会感到孤单。

sentences.english: Human life in the nature, originally impoverishment.
sentences.chinese: 人类本来生活在大自然的，日晒雨淋。

sentences.english: The advantage of this system is that it is very simple, inexpensive and almost immune to weathering.
sentences.chinese: 匙系统的优点是使用简单，成本低廉，不怕日晒雨淋。

definition: (idiom) to be exposed to the elements
lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
(of the sun) to scorch/to expose to a scorching sun
variant of 長年累月|长年累月[chang2 nian2 lei3 yue4]
year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
smoke and baking fire (idiom); surrounded by flames and smoke
